column4: The spike in violence against women during the pandemic is abhorrent. #TeamMaryland just announced $40+M in federal funds to support survivors of domestic violence + prevent violence against women. We will continue fighting for these vital resources. More: https://t.co/5TxfEkDTdJ
RT @LeaderHoyer: The American people have been waiting "weeks" for Trump‚Äôs health care plan for the last 4 years, but he never had a plan ‚Äì‚Ä¶

#COVID19 infection rates among #MD‚Äôs Latino communities are relatively higher than any other racial or ethnic population in our state. #TeamMaryland is urging @GovLarryHogan to slow the spread + provide targeted relief to Latinx families. Read our letter: https://t.co/23oDx8ubbA

Thrilled to earn a perfect score from the @cleanh2oaction for my voting record over the past year. #MD's environmental health is critical to our state's economy, culture + way of life, + I will always fight to protect it. Check out the scorecard here: https://t.co/QvPR3KUfVJ https://t.co/GOeqrareQc

Seniors in #AnneArundelCounty, sign up for the Meals on the Go program to receive a free healthy lunch prepared by Herrington on the Bay on October 7 and 14. Read the attached flyer for more information. https://t.co/VQ1gJ8AW18

#TeamMaryland just announced @JohnsHopkins will receive over $8.3M from the @NIH to bolster its #COVID19 testing and response programs to better meet the needs of underserved populations and minority communities. Read the breakdown of the grant here: https://t.co/5zErdXuHim

Wishing the President and First Lady a speedy recovery. #COVID19 is a powerful virus to which not even the President is immune. We must remain vigilant: wear a mask, practice physical distance and avoid large gatherings.

Yesterday, the House passed #bipartisan legislation that I helped draft after last year's ransomware attack in #Baltimore. State and local governments have been rich targets for cyber hackers for years, but #COVID19 has made it worse. This bill will help. https://t.co/kHU7gsFJYg

The updated #HeroesAct makes good on @HouseDemocrats‚Äô pledge to compromise while  addressing the health + economic crisis of #COVID19. @SenateGOP must finally negotiate + pass a bill that protects our heroes, crushes the coronavirus + puts money in Americans' pockets. https://t.co/mLzT7zl9j0

Joining #TeamBaltimore in announcing that @JohnsHopkins will receive $1.4+M in federal funding to lead a national study on pandemic testing gaps + disparities among transgender Americans in order to better serve members of the LGBTQ+ community. More: https://t.co/dN4mnukbpT

The updated #HeroesAct includes:
Support for small businesses, like #PPP improvements + second loans
More funds to bolster education + childcare
Support for housing assistance + food security
Funds for testing, tracing + treatment 
Second stimulus payments

Sharing on behalf of a #Baltimore company working toward a COVID-19 vaccine that is looking to fill hundreds of job openings.
https://t.co/Am0fmYp9dO

575 days. That‚Äôs how long it‚Äôs been since the House passed #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act and how long @senatemajldr has ignored the bill. Today, as gun deaths continue to rise, we #WearOrangeMasks to urge the Senate to take action. https://t.co/hT1vlDcvHI

200,000 coronavirus deaths. Each victim someone‚Äôs mother, father, child, grandparent, teacher, friend or physician. It didn‚Äôt have to be this bad. @POTUS knew COVID-19 was ‚Äòdeadly stuff‚Äô, yet deliberately downplayed its severity. 
My full statement: https://t.co/r2ulkhYeHo https://t.co/qVoDClcV7n

More federal money flowing to #Maryland ‚Äì this time, $4 million from @HHSPopAffairs to expand access to preventive care, cancer screenings, reproductive health care and more in underserved communities across our state. Read more: https://t.co/Dizr5vfJYu
Wishing all those celebrating #RoshHashanah a happy, healthy new year. L'shana Tova! https://t.co/A5bJI98yzg

The #COVID19 pandemic has made recovery even more difficult for those who are struggling. This
#RecoveryMonth, I‚Äôm wearing purple to show my support for those with substance use disorders. https://t.co/ryextd9uzL

Thrilled that @JohnsHopkins will receive close to $12.5 million to bolster its global health security initiatives and help identify emerging public health threats around the world. Read more about the @CDCgov grant here: https://t.co/SMNyFkrOQw
#TeamMaryland just announced $20M+ in emergency federal funding to support @MedStarHealth's #Covid_19 response. More: https://t.co/8dNvnm71aj

Proud to introduce my new bill today, the Dr. Joseph J. Costa HEARTS Act, named after Dr. Joseph Costa, who ran the @MdMercyBalt critical care unit + treated #COVID patients before dying from the disease himself in July. More: https://t.co/31mMjAmDaZ https://t.co/bZzftoiZ1r

Tune in, below, to watch my press conference at #Baltimore‚Äôs @MdMercyBalt live at 1pm today, where I‚Äôll be unveiling my new bill ‚Äì the Dr. Joseph J. Costa HEARTS Act ‚Äì which provides ‚Äúhero‚Äù pay to hospital workers on the #COVID19 frontlines. https://t.co/fkuxvcW9H9

Summer is coming to a close. We can‚Äôt afford to head into flu season without every possible resource necessary to fight this pandemic. @SenateMajLdr McConnell: stop playing politics with American lives and pass the #HeroesAct!

#TeamMaryland has not taken our eye off the ball when it comes to fighting the #opioidcrisis. If anything, #Covid_19 has only made it harder to access treatment + recovery services. Today we announced $50M to support @MDHealthDept's statewide efforts: https://t.co/l5ZZ5dqljf

Fantastic to see $4.5+M in federal funds awarded to @MD_Labor as part of a pilot program comabatting the opioid crisis through job training + recovery services, which will improve long-term economic + public health goals in communities across #MD. More: https://t.co/T6ZvMnStTA

Small businesses, both in #Maryland and across the country, are the engine of our economy. Pleased to announce $3.4M in federal #CARESAct funding to support small businesses in #MD02 and our state as we continue to weather the #COVID19 storm. More: https://t.co/KKVhf5hqbK

Did this directive come from the White House? What evidence is there to support this policy change? Were states and local governments consulted to understand the implications of this directive? I‚Äôm joining my colleagues in demanding answers from CDC leadership.
If the President and his staff will continue getting tested for #COVID19 despite being asymptomatic, so should the rest of the country. Not only is the @CDC‚Äôs new ruling absurd, it is dangerous.

Pleased to announce close to $844,000 in @FEMA funding to bolster #BaltimoreCity‚Äôs emergency preparedness and response efforts when faced with catastrophic events, like pandemics. Read more here: https://t.co/60VgLTLNYe

This weekend, @HouseDemocrats passed legislation to support @USPS and protect the rights of Americans to vote by mail. Today, @OversightDems will ask the Postmaster General why he pushed cuts during a pandemic and election. More: https://t.co/6mzjrSx3Vv

Great to see a local nonprofit getting some well-deserved attention. Thank you to @HLFINC for prioritizing the health of #Baltimore's children during the pandemic. Read about their work in the @washingtonpost here: https://t.co/YiedWNtmHb

Students in #MD + across the country are going hungry during the #COVID19 crisis. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre calling on @USDA leadership to extend school nutrition waivers for the 20/21 school year to ensure children have access to healthy meals. Read our letter: https://t.co/MkxrZekU4v

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram saved over 192k jobs in #MD02 + has been critical to keeping our small businesses afloat + #Marylanders employed throughout the pandemic. #PPPWorks https://t.co/gZDK6M4mvI

Many #MD workers rely on safe, dependable public transit, incl. those on the front lines during this pandemic. I‚Äôm proud to announce over $4.6M from @USDOT to upgrade bus fleets + transportation networks in #HarfordCounty + #HowardCounty. More here: https://t.co/JItjBMaA4n

I've heard from dozens of #MD02 residents who haven't gotten their mail ‚Äì incl. vital medications + paychecks ‚Äì for weeks + sometimes not at all. It's morally unacceptable to implement significant cut-backs at the height of the pandemic. Read my statement: https://t.co/PqXjrfeMni

The House and Senate each have different proposals for the next COVID-relief bill. The House has put fort the #HEROESAct while the Senate has introduced the #HEALSAct. Which do you prefer? https://t.co/HscKTrm3U5

Helped pass today's six-bill ‚Äúminibus‚Äù appropriations package that supports #MD‚Äôs military + #ChesapeakeBay-focused economies, provides a 3% pay raise for troops, funds key police reforms + authorizes emergency spending on #COVID19 vaccines + drugs. More:https://t.co/eyStdNeQMJ

COVID-19 has devastated the child care sector, forcing closures + exacerbating the shortage of quality, affordable care. I'm proud to support two bills to provide relief for families + providers + support the safe reopening of our economy. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/a1oOUtoyqm
Keep yourself and others safe during this pandemic. #WearAMask in public spaces. #OnWednesdayWeWearPink https://t.co/MPjhOUfR8D
#TeamBaltimore just announced almost $425,000 in federal funding from @NIAIDNews to support @UMBaltimore‚Äôs extensive #COVID19 research. More about the grant here: https://t.co/AKdDWLJhGH

.@HouseDemocrats voted to renew an extra $600/week for those unable to work due to COVID-19 as part of the #HeroesAct 2 months ago. These benefits will expire at the end of July if @senatemajldr McConnell doesn't act swiftly. Read my @baltimoresun op-ed: https://t.co/LlIWvPBe7b

Last week, we saw the largest single day increase in new US #COVID19 infections (67,000+). The pandemic is not over. I‚Äôm calling on @HHSgov to extend the public health emergency, expiring 7/25, to help states like #MD continue receiving federal funding. https://t.co/88ntiazYWI

Firefighters are our first line of defense in an emergency + put their lives on the line every day ‚Äì especially during this pandemic. This funding will help equip @AACoFD firefighters w/ the gear they need to protect themselves while protecting us. More:https://t.co/wfNyz7tq5Z

47,794 Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19 in the two months since @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct. It‚Äôs shameful that the Senate is dragging its feet on this critical legislation that gives American communities the tools to fight this crisis. https://t.co/NpMHuxCFug

This is yet another transparent attempt by the Trump Administration to undermine the @CDCgov's #COVID19 response and potentially politicize pandemic data in the US. We simply cannot allow this to happen. https://t.co/iZDA5Kll6b

If we are going to spend money on law enforcement, it needs to target misconduct and brutality. This is a positive step but does not dismiss the need to invest in crime prevention through housing, job training, healthcare and education. Read more here: https://t.co/wvHW81cD3s

Unsure of your paid sick leave, safe workplaces and lawful pay rights during the COVID-19 pandemic? The @USDOL's Wage and Hour Division launched a public awareness campaign to address just this. Get the info you need here: https://t.co/PhskiBw9sH

#Maryland‚Äôs agriculture sector relies on healthy pollinators. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm pleased to announce that @UofMaryland College Park will receive almost $300k from the @USDA to conduct critical research on declining honey bee colonies. More: https://t.co/IerWWeCrBl

Just joined my @AppropsDems in passing our FY2021 funding bill for military construction + #veterans. Includes $500+M for #Maryland facilities, significant funding to improve troop housing and major investment in vets healthcare. More: https://t.co/QAocii5UHu

It‚Äôs Appropriations Season + I spent the morning pouring over the 2021 budget for @DHSgov w/ my @AppropsDems colleagues. From the pandemic to terrorism, this bill provides DHS w/ the funding it needs to protect communities and Americans on land, at sea, in air + in cyberspace. https://t.co/HFGnM5g8Cp

Today I delivered 300 face masks to @YCentralMD so kids can play safely. The Y has been an outstanding community partner throughout the pandemic, providing free childcare to essential personnel in the early weeks + is now operating summer camps for children at most locations. https://t.co/03qL80V6Mt

The violence intervention program @umms @ShockTrauma has shown an 83% decrease in re-hospitalization due to intentional violent injury, a 75% reduction in criminal activity, and an 82% increase in employment. 3/3

Our bill provides federal grants to hospitals that offer social services and support to crime victims while they are recovering from their injuries, helping to end the cyclical nature of violent crime 2/3

Thrilled to hear my #bipartisan violence intervention bill w/ @RepKinzinger was highlighted at today‚Äôs @energycommerce subcommittee hearing on legislation to improve mental health during a crisis 1/3 https://t.co/S6qNPHkNJY

Just sent @fema leadership a letter, calling for them to approve #Maryland‚Äôs request for federal disaster assistance to help our state manage ongoing COVID-19 recovery efforts + prepare for future emergencies. Read #TeamMaryland‚Äôs letter here: https://t.co/TlOwJY0Yzi

During a pandemic, @realDonaldTrump wants to rob 22M Americans of access to care. Proud to be voting today to pass the Patient Protection & Affordable Care Enhancement Act for lower drug prices + premiums, expanded coverage + to fight inequity in health care. #LowerCostsForCare https://t.co/y44zVDxOTZ

Joined #TeamMaryland today in announcing $18M+ to alleviate the costs of @umms' ongoing #COVID19 response, inclu. statewide disinfection procedures, distributing PPE + providing medical services to #Marylanders. Learn more here: https://t.co/dVD2suWDT8

In times of crisis, we show what we‚Äôre made of. I am so proud of #TeamDutch‚Äôs grit and results over the last 12 weeks as we help #MD02 navigate the unchartered waters #COVID-19. Take a look. https://t.co/I1iDUDjDWt

The #coronavirus has disproportionately affected #MD‚Äôs communities of color. That‚Äôs why #TeamMaryland + I sent a letter to @GovLarryHogan, urging him to expand testing + use race + ethnicity data to develop a comprehensive plan to address this. More: https://t.co/r02hXte14R
